item.title: Chinese buyers push bitcoin price to highest level since Mt. Gox blowup
item.description:
Chinese buyers push bitcoin price to highest level since Mt. Gox blowup

By Anxieties about the unsustainable runup in Chinese corporate debt sparked a massive rally in bitcoin that sent the price of a single virtual coin to its highest level in more than two years. The price of a single bitcoin broke above $700 on Monday for the first time since early February 2014, just before the failure of a prominent bitcoin exchange ignited a years-long selloff.

item.title: Ripple Gains BitLicense in New York
item.description:
Ripple Gains BitLicense in New York

Ripple Labs Inc., has had its BitLicense application approved today by New York state's financial regulator. The New York State Department of Financial Services (NYDFS) has approved Ripple Labs ' BitLicense application. Granted today, the approval will grant Ripple the license to sell and obtain XRP - the native digital asset of the Ripple Consensus Ledger, a platform used by financial institutions including banks as well as companies.

item.title: Report: Japan's Largest Bank to Launch Digital Currency in 2017
item.description:
Report: Japan's Largest Bank to Launch Digital Currency in 2017

According to a report, the Bank of Tokyo-Mitsubishi UFJ Ltd., Japan's largest bank will soon become the world's first global bank to issue its own digital currency. A new bank-issued virtual currency may be in the offing next year.

item.title: I bought my first Bitcoin on 11/27/2013. I finally broke-even today after 2.5 years. * /r/Bitcoin
item.description:
I bought my first Bitcoin on 11/27/2013. I finally broke-even today after 2.5 years. * /r/Bitcoin

My average is $660. It feels good that I stood my ground and didn't shake out like lots of the other weak hands. My plan was always to hold for 5...

item.title: Why Are My Gridseed Blades Exploding? What Components Are Exploding?
item.description:
Why Are My Gridseed Blades Exploding? What Components Are Exploding?

I'm wanting to get into mining not so much for the mining reward but because I support the idea of decentralised currency and the power of peer to peer transactions. However I have a problem with getting some Gridseed Blades up and running. Something on them is exploding.

item.title: Bitcoin Price Has Passed the $700 USD Mark
item.description:
Bitcoin Price Has Passed the $700 USD Mark

There is still a month before the second Bitcoin block reward halving occurs, but the last two weeks or so the exchange rate of Bitcoin has been steadily increasing from a little over $400 USD to over $700 already.

item.title: Microsoft Snatches Up LinkedIn For Over US$26bn
item.description:
Microsoft Snatches Up LinkedIn For Over US$26bn

Despite LinkedIn dealing with a massive data breach not too long, the company is still attracting a lot of positive attention. So much even that Microsoft will acquire the company for US$26.2bn, all of which is to be paid in cash. The social network for professions will retain its brand and CEO, though.

item.title: 21 Inc Open-Sources Bitcoin Software for Machine Payments - CoinDesk
item.description:
21 Inc Open-Sources Bitcoin Software for Machine Payments - CoinDesk

Bitcoin startup 21 Inc announced it had open-sourced its software this weekend, a move that finds it following through on statements by the firm's co-founder and CEO, Balaji Srinivasan, at CoinDesk's Consensus event last month.

item.title: The Bitcoin Ransomware Fallacy: Why Blockchain Criminals Can Be Caught
item.description:
The Bitcoin Ransomware Fallacy: Why Blockchain Criminals Can Be Caught

The criminals responsible for Bitcoin-related crimes can very easily be held accountable provided police forces familiarise themselves with the cryptocurrency. Bitcoin, by its very nature, is inherently trackable. The suggestion that Bitcoin is anonymous is the hallmark of someone who doesn't truly understand the technology.

item.title: Bitcoin Hits Two-Year High Ahead of Key Event
item.description:
Bitcoin Hits Two-Year High Ahead of Key Event

The price of the digital currency bitcoin hit a two-year high, trading above $700 on Monday morning after it spiked 21% over the weekend as traders raced in front of an unusual event called the "halving," an adjustment to bitcoin's protocol designed to control the creation of new coins.
